Reviews:
对所有想购买这款游戏的玩家说，这款游戏是个好游戏，但是游戏的开发公司已经不足以继续对游戏进行适当的更新了。DST的开发公司已经抽调了人手去做熔炉密林，DST的更新不是带来更多内容与更高的生活质量，而是未经仔细思考的头脑发热设计、层出不穷的恶性BUG、与玩家群体倒行逆施的组合，更新不再令人期待，很少提高生活质量；而是令人沮丧，甚至会降低玩家的生活质量，摧毁玩家已经建成的基地。而开发者本身的无知与傲慢也令人难以忍受。作为开发者，Jason并不真正游玩DST游戏，他对游戏内许多相当基础的内容，如划船，武器伤害，BOSS召唤方式等等一无所知。而他不仅作为游戏内容的关键设计师，而且面对玩家忧心自己的基地被更新的内容摧毁时，他只是傲慢地表示：“那你可以关掉它。”自2024年以来，游戏的更新产能不仅减半，更新质量也变得令人难以忍受。当然，我在这里给我最喜欢的游戏打差评，也是因为我是一个老玩家，肯定是最关注最期待更新的内容，游戏的底子还是在的，但是当你体验完了原版内容后，建议体验创意工坊内容，而不是等待更新。 | Start the game. Die. Start again make it to day 5, die. Start yet again, don't know what your doing at all. die to hounds on day 7. Play with friends. Grind for 12 hours everyday, barely making it to over day 20. Start again. Spend another 12 hours on a world, make it to day 30. Die to winter. Start another world. Kill yourself in the end. | 现在已经完全不管单机版啦 所有精力投入到联机版 不过也还好 联机版可以自己开单机玩 | 主播主播，你的大力士确实很强，但是太吃操作了，有没有更加简单又强势的角色推荐一下吗？
有的兄弟有的，这么强的角色当然是不止一个了，一共有九位，都是当前能速通远古的超标角色兄弟，掌握一到两个牢九门角色兄弟，十天内打掉犀牛没有问题的，如果能掌握一半以上牢九门角色的话，那你打个熔炉前三也非常轻松，如果像主播一样，九个角色熟练度都拉满的话，那你可以直接踢掉jason去当饥荒设计师了，兄弟可以去打暴食，正好下个暴食遥遥无期，告诉主播你想要哪个？
1.威尔逊：孩子们别怕我可以用两个石砖搓一个大理石，大理石甲批发
                布豪！家里的石果快被我榨干了！
2.女武神：孩子们别怕我有高贵的电矛和统帅头盔，根本不怕巨型蠕虫和疯猪
                布豪！一不小心把电羊豆沙完了！
3.温蒂：孩子们别怕我有姐姐，清理蜘蛛巢和青蛙雨不在话下
                布豪！来的是巨鹿！
4.机器人：孩子们别怕我可以扫描升级，偷光远古
                布豪！齿轮都吃完了还没清完远古！
5.老麦：孩子们别怕我有强劲的囚笼和角斗士，轻轻松松拿捏boss
                布豪！我成计量单位了！
6.沃尔特：孩子们别怕我是超强拉扯王，能无伤克劳斯
                布豪！沃比把我甩下去了，我的san值要炸掉了！
7.旺达：孩子们别怕我有无敌的警钟和裂缝表，快餐档速通没我不行
                布豪！夏冬季忘带暖石了！
8.植物人：孩子们别怕我会种地，饥荒变饱荒
                布豪！自己一个人玩回血回得慢！
9.维斯;........ | 温蒂，沃尔特，沃拓克斯技能树第二次跳票，对玩家有利的更新寥寥无几，恶心玩家的东西出了一堆重量级，传奇设计师杰森一句“你可以关掉它”感觉给游戏未来判了死刑

平心而论，游戏是个好游戏。无论是由装备决定卡组使得组卡组时要综合考虑不至于每张牌都是烂强卡导致卡组千篇一律，还是多种类型的卡片的组合导致战术的多样化，PVE模式的趣味性和PVP模式的斗智斗勇（特别说一下PVP，这个游戏的PVP是真正的根据每期地图和其他对手决定的，比如对面全法师就能采用三战士六豹打，或者两战一牧，对面带五甲的战士多你的战士就多带破甲和穿甲，总之相对复杂的卡组构建，不断变化的地图和多种多样的战术选择使这个游戏的PVP充满了乐趣），还有趣味联赛中的娱乐性更强的对战，丰富多彩的收集元素，以及良心的日商周商使得不氪金也能轻松成为大佬，种种因素使得这个游戏是不错的游戏，即使没有汉化也不影响它本身的趣味性，看到这里大家就应该明白我对这个游戏的喜爱和推荐了吧。
然而，问题不仅仅这么简单，这么优秀的游戏却有着一群跟我们思维构造不同的GM和MOD，他们在没有事先通知的情况下封了几乎所有参加过PVP的人，而且时间有的多达30天甚至是365天，经常玩这个游戏热爱这个游戏每天游戏时间足够长的所有国人无一幸免，而且申诉机制异常奇怪，真正该封禁的人被解封了，无辜群众反而被关在了里面，据一些因为玩游戏频率不高而侥幸逃过一劫的国人反应，本来偏小众的游戏的在线人数进一步减少，本来一场联赛平时1分钟以内就一定能排到对手现在却排了四五分钟都无法匹配成功，游玩人数大量减少，玩家纷纷弃坑，然而面对这种结果，GM和MOD却仍然表示满意，绝对自己做得很是正确。另外，由于这个游戏是人治，所以管理上有明显的偏袒，和mod关系好的人不会被封禁然而其余人很容易被封禁，据少数国人反应，游戏内可能有一定反华倾向，在世界打字中文会收获到举报，总之你一定要做好随时被封禁的心理准备即使你只是正常的老老实实的玩游戏。一次封禁很有可能直接抹消掉你之前的时间和金钱投入，所以，即使这个游戏很有趣，但大家入坑前还是要慎重，即使决定了入坑，购买付费内容的时候还是要慎重，毕竟，他们封禁你的时候不会在乎你花了几百几千人民币的。 | Pros:  I was transported back in time 30 years, the flavor and feel of PnP RPG gaming is perfect.  The metagame story is fun and interesting.  Felt like the 1980s...

Cons:  The micropayment cash grab is gross.  You can play free for @30hrs, then you need to start buying access.
Also: this game is a _very cheap_ strat game, with minimalist card building elements.

If you want to feel the nostalgia - play for free.  Any other reason should be a pass.

I give it a thumbs up BARELY and only for the story and feels.  The game is a grind - barely entertaining. | 平时网好的时候用网页版，方便。只有网不好才用客户端，所以看起来游戏时间很少。
算上网页版至少700hrs+
好玩，时间证明一切。

Uma porrada de itens e habilidades, tudo perfeito. Eu pagaria um preço fixo para comprar, mas por ser free to play tem uma quantidade imensa de boosters que vc compra e melhora o jogo. Apesar de ser uma realidade dos jogos atuais, isso me irrita um pouco. Prefiro pagar pelo jogo inteiro de uma vez...

This is a very difficult game to recommend, but I will still attempt to recommend it regardless.

As someone who grew up in the golden age of Flash browser games, this one always stuck out to me as one of the most consistently good tower defense games in the entire genre. Yes, even better than Bloons.

The tower systems have an unimaginable amount of complexity, and the skill ceiling for their use and design is so stupidly high that people have designed scripts to automatically craft optimal gems with upwards of 50 different components.

However, in order to reach those heights, you first have to get through the game casually, and I must say that this is one of the hardest video games I have ever played. The difficulty of the middle section of the game is bone-crushing, requiring exact precision, map knowledge, and at some points, seemingly just grinding for skill points to give a final push through the hex.

It’s not for the faint of heart, but it is an incredibly good game despite its difficulty. Should you conquer this game’s arduous challenges, you’ll be deeply satisfied, and the post-game content (that is to say, redoing stages in Endless) is very fun and rewarding.

Definitely a hidden gem, even if it is a bit rough. | Quite okay. Fun for plenty of time for an okay price. The game is fun at the beginning, then is pain called "getting to Amplifiers", then is fun again for a while. Not quite balanced, but pretty fun regardless. Worth checking out generally speaking, and definitely when on a sale. | Simple, yet fun. Graphics are good enough, gameplay is addictive. And its quite cheap. | Played a version of this ages ago, Gem Craft is from a time when tower defense games had to actually be good to get published anywhere outside of flash game websites. The fact that I'm willing to pay money for a tower defense game speaks volumes about how much playtime I'm about to give this game. | Good tower defense game play.

I'd probably go $5 or play element td2 which looks a ton better.
Both games are good this one's just lacking some graphics that's all.

Been playing this since its EA debut and it's always been kind of mid as a brawler, but going from F2P to offering these insanely priced packages (sure no one is forcing you to buy them) where each legend tries to top the last is just straight up battlepass BS at its worst. Thumbs down. | Brawlhalla é um jogo de luta estilo plataforma que traz uma experiência divertida e viciante, ideal para quem gosta de combates rápidos e dinâmicos. Com um elenco variado de personagens, cada um com seus próprios movimentos e habilidades, o jogo oferece uma boa dose de diversidade e possibilidades estratégicas.

A jogabilidade é fluida e fácil de aprender, mas oferece bastante profundidade para jogadores mais experientes que buscam melhorar suas habilidades. O combate é centrado em plataformas suspensas, onde o objetivo é lançar os oponentes para fora da tela, o que adiciona um toque único aos duelos.

Um dos maiores pontos fortes de Brawlhalla é a sua acessibilidade: é gratuito | get to diamond once then quit playing | HAOWAN | .

Perhaps others may enjoy this game, but I do not. The art style and music are neat and well done, but I found the game itself to be incredibly punishing. Getting one shot by enemy attacks, or failing because I accidentally shot a friendly was definitely frustrating, but I could work with that, and when that is all that I have to worry about, then the game can be rather fun. What really made me not want to play the game anymore was the apples / litter. Perhaps if your bullets were a lot faster, then I would be more amenable to the existence of apples, but failing a level because I didn't shoot an apple in time felt frustrating in a way that simply wasn't fun. | An adorably simple FPS that keeps you engaged with ramping difficulty as you progress.  Blazing through the first 11 levels kept me somewhat interested but had me hoping that I wouldn't get bored too quickly.  Right after finishing this stage did I finally notice the star ranking system and how I only had 2/3 stars... defeat every enemy, finish the level under the par time, and stay 100% accurate.  This really opened my third eye in terms of fun and getting 3 stars on a given level before advancing to the next one was my definitive way to enjoy the game.  

Lovely Planet's projectile flower gun particularly scratches my itch for skillful gunplay which plays incredibly well for bombs that must be shot midair before they reach the ground.  Each shot is fairly slow so you'll have to consider each bomb's current speed and your distance away from it to get those satisfying airshots, the game is no slouch from expecting you to not only play through it quickly but also be ready to sometimes shoot several at a time in quick succession.  Lovely Planet's other mechanics are slowly introduced in each world and help encourage you to play the game in the most enjoyable way possible.  Much like it's arcade contemporaries there are plenty of easier ways to play if the game is giving you too much trouble.  Your gun is semi-automatic so shooting bombs and enemy fire makes things considerably easier, the game does force you to play fast at times but these are more along the lines of micro challenges over playing an entire level quickly from start to end.

I had just about no issues with the game aside from some Japanese text not being translated and would've loved to have an optional crosshair.  The game is more than playable regardless but these are small blemishes on an otherwise great experience.  All in all a short but satisfying arcade shooter, absolutely worth the purchase if you're up for a somewhat challenging time with a relaxing artstyle! | Nome: Lovely Planet
Visual: Fofo
Objetivo: Espalhar o ódio | lovely planet | buy it

muito legal, devia ser legal com 4 pessoas, mas o fodido do meu amigo nao quis compar quando tava 2,50, vai tomar no cu fagner | Great Classic game to get into!
I saw this game on a super sale and never had the thought on my mind to get this when it came out when it first released, and super glad that did. The game doesn't say a single word just noises from the characters, the game is mainly a button masher with combo keys to defeat your enemies that you come across by yourself, or with your friends. The game is however having a shelf life of over a decade to strike your opponent you have to perfectly in line with them to land a hit on them. You are able to battle your friends near the end of some of the missions to see who can get the princess. Which I think is really interesting idea because it incorporates testing your skills against your team mates on whether or not you are carrying them through out the game, to see if they can match up to you on your level and compete against them while playing with them to defeat the missions.
The only issue that I do see in this game if you are playing this on PC that you have to make sure that you join while you are out of game and someone invites you while they are in game, and by launching it from the invite window, or you will be counted as two players, one counting as the keyboard, and the other counting as your controller.

In my opinion, this is a really fun and enjoyable game that you can play with yourself or your friends that you are on with. I got this game on a super sale, and even thought that this game is fun and enjoyable to play on. I do highly recommend this game to be bought on a sale due to the shelf life that this game has and how long that this has been out for. | 游戏总体上，8/10分，优秀
抱着为童年买票还是和朋友战斗爽，都很合适。美式无厘头的画风很搞，战斗也主打一个有手就行，可收集内容也足够充足，而且如果只是想要体验一遍全流程的话，4~6小时即可，当然建议多周目联机游玩。
但是缺点也很明显，敌人种类单一，比玩家还苟的纯读指令BOSS，明显在拖延游戏时间的关卡设计，并且没有人性化设计的存档机制，但就整体来说，不是很影响游戏的游玩，尤其作为多人游戏时，还是推荐的。 | I loved this game growing up, and it is still peak even in 2025. If you have 4 hours to spare, I highly recommend this game with a friend or three. Castle Crashers is such a charming co op hack and slash game. Genuinely top 10 game of all time imo. |  挺有意思的横版闯关，最高配置是三个和自己喜好一样的朋友。

вы играете  за квадратного чела который спасает квадратного чела, он проходит квадратный театр  и в нём квадратные уровни  которые построили квадратные кaты что бы на вас смотрели ещё больше квадратных  катов, вы можете пройти уровень и получить кристаллы которые можете потратить на покупку ещё более квадратных челов за которых вы сможете сыграть. | It's fun, fast paced, the story is wild, no one believes in you, you can blow your friends with mines, and you can watch them drown, what more joy do you need? | A trilha sonora do jogo é uma clássica obra prima que me faz chorar quando eu a ouço, tanto pelos olhos quando pelo ouvido de tão boa que é. jogue com seu melhor amigo, você não ira se arrepender. | Es un juego increible para jugar con amigos un juego para divertirse y si te gusta mucho jugarlo solo pero la verdad lo mejor en este juego es el cooperativo

Genres: Action, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Simulation, Free To Play
Reviews:
Разработчики уничтожили игру

Очень любил эту игру до того,как разработчики испортили её.Раньше все старались построить хорошие машины,выбрать те оружия,которые им по душе.Были Тиры,и каждый Тир был сбалансирован,не было через чур(были,но немного) сильный противников.Было Древо улучшений.А сейчас - разнацветные кубики,пыль,кейсы,игроки строят коробки на одной ножке или коробки с ротором и цепляют на него самые имбалансные пушки,которые выпали из купленных кейсов.Подбор противников просто ужасен.Игру облегчили для максимума(чтобы любой идиот,у которого есть деньги мог играть в это и донатить как можно больше) и превратили в помойку.Раньше было намного лучше.Разработчикам важен только донат,а не сама игра. | Uwaga! Opis mechanik gry jest już przestarzały(wyjaśnienie na końcu);

Dobry przykład jak ze świetnej gry zrobić totalnego gniota bez balansu nastawionego na grind i mikrotranzakcje wymuszające kupno premium by mieć jakąkolwiek szansę normalnego rozwoju konta. Gra kilka lat temu była świetna, przyjemny rozwój robotów, przyjemne walki, gra była nastawiona na umiejętności budowy robotów, co było bardzo ważną umiejętnością, a walka polegała na starannym niszczeniu najsłabszych punktów przeciwnika. Było trochę problemów z balansem, ale twórcy kompletnie nie potrafili ich naprawić mimo tego, że gracze pisali wielokrotnie co trzeba zmienić.

Twórcy wszystkie problemy zaczęli "rozwiązywać" od najgorszej strony, tworząc przy okazji nowe problemy. Z czasem gra straciła jakikolwiek sens posiadania umiejętności budowy, ponieważ teraz często liczy się kto pierwszy zaatakuje, a nie skill. Tutaj już nawet nie trzeba budować, twórcy dali możliwość kupowania robotów innych graczy, przez co nie ma sensu się starać, lepiej kupić potężnego bota aktualnej mety, po co budować, skoro wszystko i tak będzie gorsze? Tu też przychodzi drugi problem, balans. Zawsze był z tym problem, lecz kiedyś nie aż tak duży. Jak zwykle twórcy nie potrafią rozwiązywać problemów, przez to w grze jest pewna tzw. "meta", czyli najskuteczniejsze boty w grze. Przez idotyczne decyzje twórców ta liczba w tej chwili wynosi bodajże 3(tak, 3 typy robotów są skutecznie na wyższym poziomie umiejętności, reszta to strata nerwów i przegrywanie). Mobilność bota jest wszystkim ponieważ nawet najtwardsze boty topnieją w chwilę, więc nie ma sensu budować niczego innego. Chcesz pobawić się tworząc ładnie wyglądającego bota? Zapomnij, chyba, że nie masz nic przeciwko przegrywaniu 3/4 gier. Twórcy nie potrafią rozwiązać jakichkolwiek problemów z balansem. Do tego doszedł system skrzynek, który polega po prostu na tym, że gigantycznie zmniejszył średnią zdobywaną kasę za bitwę oraz zachęca do kupowania premium w postaci "patrz, super rzadki item, kup premium to go dostaniesz!". Bitwa za bitwą a zbudować to, co przedtem mogliśmy po ~30 bitwach teraz musimy zagrać ich ~200. Chyba, że ma się farta i się wydropi legendarny przedmiot. Ewentualnie gra pokaże go w slocie premium i będzie chciała zachęcić do jego kupna. Recykling bezużytecznych itemów na kasę w grze daje idiotycznie małe wartosci, prawie nic, gracze domagali się podniesienia wartości recyklingu, po wielu miesiącach, twórcy w końcu zrobili to, ale tylko, kiedy ma się premium(!), powodując, że teraz premium nie tylko dwukrotnie zwiększa ilośc itemów ze skrzynek, to teraz trzykrotnie zwiększa wartość recyklingu każdego itema. p2w tego nie można do końca nazwać, ale definitywnie jest to PayWall. Aktualne premium powoduje, że otrzymamy tyle, ile przed updatem zanim zmniejszyli nagrody za bitwy. Grając za darmo otrzymujemy 6x mniej. Powodzenia zbudować bota z ulubionym wyposażeniem. Gra bez premium to katorga, W dodatku gra jest wieczną alfą, co służy tylko temu, by twórcy mogli sobie dowoli zmieniać so chcą, np. jeszcze bardziej zwiększając rolę mikropłatności w grze. W rzeczywistości gra jest w gorszym stanie niż 2,5 lat temu. Kilka miesięcy temu było baardzo źle i weterani uciekali od tego szajsu. Teraz jest jeszcze gorzej.

Podsumowując: Stuprocentowy negatyw.

@edit 24.05.2019 r.
Sporo się zmieniło, nie ma już lootboxów, powrócili (nieudolnie) do tierów oraz drzewka technologii. Gra jest nadal masakryczna. Fizyka skopana, najlepsze roboty to pojedyncza broń T5 na lekkim i szybkim(najlepiej latającym) bocie. "Connecting To Server" wszędzie, a w dodatku by zniwelować ubytek graczy nie można już wybrać trybu gry z rotacją co godzinę. Tak. Ta sama mapa, ten sam tryb, te same ustawienia PRZEZ GODZINĘ. Dodali ulepszanie broni(by zadawały jeszcze więcej DMG!), więc TTK jeszcze bardziej zmniejszyli(za czasów Overclockingu ludzie nienawidzili buffowania DMG, widać twórcy nic się nie nauczyli). Robopassy dające jakieś kiepskie kosmetyczne przedmioty by trochę kasy wyciągnąć z umierającej gry.
Od Grudnia 2018 r. stracili połowę istniejących graczy. Jak to zrobili? Pośrednio twórcy w końcu zobaczyli, że Robocraft z początków był lepszy, więc próbują wprowadzać rzeczy i mechanikę, która była w tamtym czasie. Problem jest taki, że po pierwsze robią to nieumiejętnie, po drugie, że nadal próbują swoje "nowości". Na końcu otrzymujemy dziadostwo, w które nie da się grać. W tą grę gra mniej ludzi niż w Spore. I pomyśleć, że Robocraft ze swoją unikalną receptą na grę posiadał ponad 7 tysięcy aktywnych graczy.

Jakiś czas temu wyszli z Early Access, a przynajmniej zrobili to teoretycznie, bo gra nadal się zmieniała drastycznie. W sumie gra jest w gorszym stanie niż w czasie wczesnego EA.

@Edit, 14.07.2019.
No i stało się. Robocraft upadł. Freejam zwalnia ludzi bo mają mało kasy, przyznali się, że Robocraft po opłaceniu serwerów wychodzi na minus. Wszystkie zasoby idą na RobocraftX(tworzenie gry od początku). Będą utrzymywać serwery tak długo jak to będzie możliwe i naprawiać większe bugi. Kilka lat ludzie pisali co jest źle z grą, mówili jakie błędy popełniają twórcy, wszystko dostali na tacy, twórcy mieli to gdzieś i dalej rozwalali grę po swoją tajemniczą "wizję", która się zmieniała co update dalej rozwalając grę dziwnymi rozwiązaniami, o które nikt nie prosił. To się nie mogło inaczej skończyć Radzę nie wydawać nawet grosza na tą grę, bo pieniądze mogą przepaść. | Encontre este juego hace unos años atras. Encontre un potencial exito indie multiplayer, como por ejemplo lo que hoydia es Rocket League.
Me enamore de sus mecanicas, y del desarrollo que Freejam de entregaba a su juego, sin duda yo me alegre bastante cuando Robocraft gano el Indie del Año por parte de IndieDB.

Era esos dias en donde era una Arena 10vs10, donde llegar a Tier 10 te hacia en uno de los mejores del juego. En donde tenias que ser consistente para ir desbloqueando todas las mejoras del arbol de tecnologias. En donde la sinergia del jugador y su maquina, y lo mas importante y lo que actualmente se perdio: completo trabajo en equipo. Y quien llevaba a nivel 100 era considerado un Dios.

Donde la habilidad era para saber construir el mejor vehiculo, en todos los ambitos posibles. En donde se copiaban diseños pero aun asi quedaban con un toque personal.

Esos dias. Antes de las torres. Antes de los Megabots. Antes de los medicos.
Cuando solo habian 3 clases. Y aun asi digo que la inclusion de los medicos dio un giro muy positivo al juego.

Donde TODOS. Iban en una fila por una de las 2 lineas principales del mapa. Y en donde se producia un 50/50 en donde podia quedar la absoluta mie*da en una batalla de 10vs10 frente a frente. Y en donde el equipo contrario llegaria a su base y el equipo de dividia para ir a defender la base.

Updates pasaban y no habia tanto cambio. Incluso la inclusion de las torres era una idea fantastica, y todo el mundo en los foros dio su apoyo. Pero simplemente y en mera opinion mia, no fue ejecutada de manera efectiva, o sonaba mejor en papel. Aun asi el juego era bastante bueno en esos momentos y todavia se apreciaba ese espiritu competitivo. Lo que realmente afecto al juego fue el sistema de respawn. Antes la gente hacia cosas imposibles para sobrevivir. O intentar capturar la base enemiga. Con el respawn vi morir frente a mi todo eso.

Hasta que 2 mecanicas nuevas mataron mi idea original del juego.
Las cajas y el nuevo sistema de "dinero".

Incluso yo estaba a favor de perder dinero por reparar el vehiculo cada vez que perdias. Y ahora hasta puedes comprar vehiculos prefabricados.
Seguramente si el juego hubiera ido por buen camino, ahora mismo estaría jugando competitivamente en un clan.

Pero lamentablemente soñar no cuesta nada. Intentar arreglar la dignidad de este juego, mucho.

EDIT:

Me han llegado comentarios que estoy tirando mie*da al juego solamente porque soy ("fui") "manco". Los estoy borrando porque la verdad no demuestran nada objetivo.

Si le puse mucha dedicacion para ser mejor en el juego, entrenando y mejorando. Para despues darme cuenta que el juego iba a caer como lo hizo ahora, cualquier persona no estaría contenta por ello. Y me incluyo como todos los demas. | [h1]Ruined by Developer Decisions and Carelessness[/h1]

This was one of my favorite games back in 2014. It had everything you could ask for: balancing, a good community, active and attentive devs, weapons that complemented each other, fun gameplay, good progression, lack of "pay2win" and so forth. Needless to say, it was awesome.

Then the January 2015 update was released.

The January 2015 update added a new gamemode where you destroy towers, levelled up, and respawn if destroyed. Initially, me and the rest of the community thought "Cool." and waited to see what else was in store. Little did I know that the downfall of Robocraft had begun.

(Order not completely accurate)

"Megabots" (gigantic robots basically) were removed as soon as the update came out, if not before.

Crates were introduced (partially replacing the robits system), level based CPU limits eliminated, and the tech tree removed, eliminating progression, reducing creativity, and generally made the game much worse. Despite the huge outcry and the veterans and other players who started to leave the game, the devs simply ignored the community and moved on.

Helicopter blades were added, enabling people to make flying fortresses (maybe literrally). Personally I don't think much of this.

Then weapons, most notably an anti-air cannon and a minigun, were added, making weapons unbalanced and the game more frustrating to play. As a pilot in Robocraft (a more "traditional" one who used plasma bombers), this particulary saddened and angered me.

A robot shop was added, further reducing creativity.

An intro was added into the game, giving the game a more "cheezy" feel and making it seem as if the developers were copying other games. By this point, I personally felt that the developers were catering more toward children (12 year olds) and no longer valued older players and veterans.

All this time, veterans and other older players were leaving the game as it became increasingly apparent that the developers were not listening to the community. 

A new chat system was added, featuring a clan system that the community had been asking for for a long time. This was not nearly enough however, as the other changes above (as well as others) and the careless developers made the game unenjoyable for me (and potentially other older players, although I can not speak for them on this matter).

I finally left Robocraft for good in mid 2015 (shortly after the new chat system was introduced) after a brief stint operating a hovercraft with SMGs.

In it's current state, Robocraft is unbalanced and unenjoyable. The developers are careless and possibly largely inactive (aside from bugfixes and tweaks). Gameplay is frustrating, gamemodes horrible. 

As another reviewer (spynathan) has said: "From Robocraft to Robocrap."

If, somehow, all (and I mean all) changes to the game were reverted back to sometime before the January 2015 update, say, November 2014, me and other members of the community (read their reviews to see what they have to say) who have left Robocraft may very well return.

Until then, goodbye Robocraft. | 看我的游戏时间就知道了。这确实是一个好游戏，我还买了永久会员，但他现在确实让我失望了。我也是从T级时代走过来的人，RC的变化我也历历在目。不过现在，FJ的小霸王服务器，将游戏改的一塌糊涂，各种毒瘤载具对新手的压制，虽然出了简体中文，玩家也更多了，但为什么RC的评价在从好评如潮下滑到褒贬不一呢？我们应该思考，FJ更应该思考。

Genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
Reviews:
Giriş:
Unturned, Nelson Sexton tarafından geliştirilen ve 2014 yılında erken erişime açılan ücretsiz bir hayatta kalma oyunudur. Oyun, blok tarzı grafiklerle sunulan bir dünyada geçer ve oyuncuların hayatta kalmak için kaynak toplaması, barınak inşa etmesi ve zombilerle savaşması gerekmektedir.

Oynanış:
Unturned, oyunculara geniş bir dünya sunar. Kaynak toplama, yiyecek bulma ve silah yapma gibi temel hayatta kalma unsurlarıyla doludur. Zombilerle dolu bu dünyada, hayatta kalmak için stratejik düşünmek önemlidir. Ayrıca, oyuncular arasında işbirliği yapma veya rekabet etme seçeneği de vardır.

Kendi Yorumum:
Oynanış dinamikleri oldukça eğlenceli ve bağımlılık yapıcı. Özellikle arkadaşlarla birlikte oynandığında, keşif ve hayatta kalma unsurları çok daha keyifli hale geliyor. Ancak, bazen oyunun basit grafikleri ve mekanikleri bazı oyuncular için çekiciliğini azaltabilir.

Grafikler ve Ses:
Unturned, blok tarzı grafiklerle sunulmasına rağmen, bu tasarımın kendine özgü bir cazibesi var. Ses efektleri, oyunun atmosferini destekliyor, ancak bazen daha fazla çeşitlilik bekleyebilirsiniz.

Kendi Yorumum:
Grafikler basit olsa da, bu durum oyunun eğlencesini etkilemiyor. Hatta bazı oyuncular bu tarzı sevebilir. Ancak, daha gerçekçi bir deneyim arayanlar için hayal kırıklığı yaratabilir.

Topluluk ve Mod Desteği:
Unturned, aktif bir topluluğa ve geniş bir mod desteğine sahiptir. Oyuncular, çeşitli modlar ve sunucular aracılığıyla oyunu özelleştirebilir. Bu, oyunun ömrünü uzatır ve farklı deneyimler sunar.

Kendi Yorumum:
Topluluk, oldukça destekleyici ve yenilikçi. Modlar, oyunun eğlencesini artırıyor ve sürekli yeni içerikler sunuyor. Ancak, bazı sunuculardaki toksik davranışlar can sıkıcı olabilir.

Sonuç:
Unturned, hayatta kalma oyunları arasında kendine özgü bir yer edinmiştir. Basit ama eğlenceli yapısıyla, oyunculara hem zorlu hem de keyifli bir deneyim sunar. Eğer arkadaşlarınızla birlikte eğlenceli bir hayatta kalma oyunu arıyorsanız, Unturned kesinlikle denemeye değer. Kişisel olarak, bu oyunun sunduğu eğlence ve topluluk etkileşimleri, onu benim favori oyunlarımdan biri haline getiriyor. | ein bester server und spilt es holt euch das gold dlc | KA*AR ERAYIN BİLGİSAYARININ KALDIRDIĞI TEK OYUN | yes, and yes | 不好玩

Pros:
+Fun
+Lots of guns and mods for said guns to choose from
+Interesting enemy design and boss mechaincs
+Giant Robots
+Chill Turkish people everywhere
+RNG table is surprisingly generous
+you get tons of revive tokens for free from the "bullet" system (RNG boxes)
+very easy to learn
+cool drones follow you around and shoot stuff for you

Cons:
-very few players at lower difficulties
-need to play lower difficulties to unlock higher ones
-need to be level 15+ to do anything in PvP because the novice PvP server is a ghost town
-takes forever to level up
-RNG based loot crates ("bullets") can give you as little as 2 revive tokens
-revive tokens for PvE, if you die, you need to spend a token
-There's very few players
-high-level playeers can be rude and have VERY OP weapons that kinda take the fun out of PvE
-not fun at all solo
-nobody ever talks, except to call you a noob in the rare event that a new player manages to get into expert/nightmare stuff
-no voice chat, really hurts the cooperative feel
-also, I'm pretty sure this game's going to be dead in about a year, anyway (though EnMasse has a really good track record of keeping a decently sized core playerbase: see TERA)

The gameplay consists of using a grappling hook (really just a red line) to swing around in arcing trajectories in order to collide with some red bars. The levels consist of some randomly-placed grey boxes to which are attached red bars. The more bars you collide with (while avoiding collisions with the grey boxes), the higher your score. That's. . . basically the whole game. Pressing "enter" allows you to skip to the next level, but as far as I can tell all of the levels are pretty much exactly the same. Just randomly-placed boxes. There doesn't seem to be a clear objective to the game either, aside from simply getting a high score. There is no endgame as far as I can tell.

Honestly, this looks like a simple proof-of-concept prototype that could have been made in Unity in an afternoon. There's hardly any content and the gameplay gets boring after a few minutes. A point in the game's favour is that it's free, so I can't really complain about the price. If you're curious, you might as well download it and try it out for yourself. But I wouldn't personally recommend it.

I’ve had this game in my library for a long time, and every now and then, I try to give it another chance. But honestly, every time I do, I end up frustrated and quitting.



Let’s talk about why.

1. Controls: They feel clunky and unresponsive, making even basic movement a chore.

2. Combat: The combat system is unpolished and lacks any sense of satisfaction or strategy.

3. Crafting: While crafting is an important part of the game, the system feels unnecessarily complicated.

4. No Search Feature: One of the most frustrating aspects is trying to find what you want to craft. Without a search bar, you spend too much time scrolling through menus, which ruins the flow of the game.



I really wanted to enjoy this game, but these issues make it hard to stick with it. I hope the developers take feedback like this into consideration for future updates or projects. | Its so bad its good! treat it as you would getting fast food on a late night with friends after work. Skyrim gibi bir zamanda geçen hayatta kalma oyunu diyebiliriz. Kılıçlar, zırhlar, kalkanlar, potlar, kurtlar, iskeletler, yürüyen yerden bitme ağaçlar, normal hayvanlar ve bir ejderha. İnşa edilebilir sığınaklar, üretim masaları, sandıklar ve tuzaklar. Madenler, ağaçlar, çalılıklar ve değerli taşlar. Oyun bir hayatta kalma oyunu ve çok da zor sayılmaz. Oyun biraz düz bir çizgide ilerliyor çünkü zırhlar ve silahlar siz ilerledikçe elde edilebilir hale geliyorlar. Mesela ilk adada iki boss var, bunlar için adada elde edebileceğiniz kalay ile zırh ve silah yapıyorsunuz ve işler biraz kolaylaşıyor, öteki adaya geçince öteki adada elde edilebilir olan bakır ve demir ile zırhlar ve silahlar üretip ikinci adadaki 4 boss'u öldürdükten sonra bir sonraki adaya geçiyorsunuz gibi gibi. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3410166989

Oyunda taşlar genel olarak tekrar tekrar kırılabilir ama ağaçlar tekrar büyümüyor. Çalılıkların bir kısmını kırpıp küçük bir parça bıraktığınızda oyunu açıp kapatınca çalılıklar tekrar büyüyorlar. Oyunun haritasında genel olarak çok fazla ağaç ve çalılık var zaten o yüzden yeniden büyümelerine de gerek yok diye düşünüyorum. Hem ağaçları ve çalılıkları ortadan kaldırarak görüşünüzü de temizleyebilirsiniz. Harita tertemiz olunca düşmanlar gözden kaçmıyor, güzel oluyor. Eğer çok ağaç lazım olursa yeni bir dünya oluşturun, ihtiyacınız kadar ağaç ve çalılık kesin ve o dünyayı silebilirsiniz. Bir tane karakter oluşturup o karakteri hem çevrimiçi olarak hem de solo olarak kullanabilirsiniz. Oluşturduğunuz dünyalar arasında aynı karakter ile geçiş yapabilirsiniz.

Oyuna girince çimen görünürlüğünü tamamen düşürün, hem fps konusunda yardımcı oluyor hem de etrafa baktığınızda daha temiz gözüküyor ve yerdeki eşyaları, tavşanları falan daha kolay görüyorsunuz.
Endlessly replayable game

A great concept for a game with loads of potential that has, sadly, been completely abandoned by its developer before being finished.  So unless you want to spend your money on an abandoned, unfinished project then give it a pass.

It's a real shame, too, because this game could have been great with more work & polish, but sadly that will never happen now. | Isomer is an interesting mixture of surivial and basebuilding gameplay from games such as Dwarf Fortress combined with combat and exploration elements inspired by the Xcom series. The overall premise can be summed as reverse Xcom, you play as an alien force stumbling upon an already habited planet yet seeking to colonize never the less. Starting off with your humble dropship and ten workers, it is your job to survive and thrive in an hostile world. Overall in its inital steam release status, I'd say that Isomer is a very promising game. Currently I feel as though the foundations for a great base building and exploration are present though the content may be too barebones for some. So far I've noticed four diffrent unit classes, a wide array of generated structures for the player to explore and various different building blocks for the player to use. However the selection of middle and late game structures don't seem to be implemented. For example you can build your base to the extent of its layout with lights and lifts to different floors, but there are no doors present in the game nor any sizeable modules and things to fill up these rooms apart from soils to contain reasources. 
Check out my Let's Play below!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f7VcA1f11R8 | Isomer is a great game that HAD potential... But unfortunatly the Developer of Isomer is either dead or he has some other rubish excuse for not completing this great idea of a game. Hopefully the Dev will be resurrected like jesus was but he can come back as developer jesus and finish the game he started to create. Other than that i would say its a good purchase but its not worth it until the developer decides to use social interaction with the people that payed to fund the creation of Isomer. | While this game is young and isn't that fun or easy to play at this point of time it does still have a good idea behind it and i hope it will turn out better then the other games likes it (towns Etc). I do wish it turns in to the game it should be | This games got plenty of potential but the no. 1 thing which bugs me right now is the leveling (underground-above ground etc.) i just got fed up when i was attacked and couldnt select my units even though i could see them because they were 1 block lower than the camera, then when i did select them and selected where the enemy was the aliens wouldnt move as they were on a different level despite being able to reach the location if you raise your camera. 

Overall the game needs to be updated (though this is still just an alpha) but could be a very fun game in the future and may only recommend buying for the current price =)
A pity that this jewel is not further developped.

Reviews:
Heroes & Generals 初期不管是薪資、實力，也許對新兵不是很有利。老兵也是長久累積下來的，嘗試不同武器、走位，都是這遊戲中一大樂趣。還有就是這遊戲是免費的，也許不能跟其他大概比較，我給她分數挺高的，10分之中8分，剩下是玩家和官方一起努力的地方。平衡老實說 有漸漸再改了，從以前到現在 已經好很多了；機制這一方面，我是覺得不錯，但還有些稍微改進的地方，有了小隊系統，玩家看的出來稍有團結，至於人數平衡 等待死亡玩家，算是還行以防一面倒情形，玩競賽最怕人數壓制。
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
如果你是新兵，可以找朋友或認識一起玩，比較不會失去遊戲熱忱，可以互相幫忙。然後請友善看待這遊戲，畢竟這是免費的，官方也有持續更新，銀幣有可以解鎖或買全部東西，雖然新兵薪水稍低，但等級有比較好練了(跟過往砍了一半)

我是從Beta到正式版玩家，如果上述有不妥的話，請老玩家見諒。覺得不錯，希望給予讚，並讓遊戲分出去 | -Falls Du die Bewertungen ließt um zu entscheiden ob Du Dir dieses Spiel herunterladen solltest:
Schaue nicht weiter und guck dir lieber:

-->POST SCRIPTUM<-- an.



Ich hab jetzt schon etliche Stunden in diesem Spiel verbracht. Es ist einfach so frustrierend was für ein potential dieses Spiel hat, aber komplett ungenutzt bleibt. Nicht nur die kompetenzen der Entwickler sind fraglich.

Die Grafik ist grundsätzlich nicht hochmodern, hat aber einfach einen Reiz.
Waffensounds sind unterirdisch auch Fahrzeuge hören sich richtig schlecht an.

Lächerlich ist, das sobald man Kritik am Spiel äußßert oder verbesserungsvorschläge hat, man sofort ausgeschlossen wird aus dem Forum und den Kommentaren.

Desweiteren betreiben die Entwickler das Spielsystem derart, das man ewig benötigt um etwas Freizuschalten. Hat man erstmal alles... sammeln sich die Credits natürlich über die Zeit sofern man nicht gerade 200.000Cr für ein Camo ausgibt.

Zu dem sind die Entwickler ULTRA FAUL, jeder deutsche Panzer hat beispielsweise das selbe Camo. Es wird sich also in keinster Weise mühe gegeben wirklich individualität zu schaffen.
Man muss sich folgendes vor Augen führen: Vor einem halben Jahr oder länger haben sau viele Panzer Camos bekommen, auf deutscher Seite haben alles die gleichen bekommen. Der Panzer "Panther" wurde außenvor gelassen. Erst vor kurzen haben dann der Panther und die Panzer IV ebenfalls Camos bekommen, ABER GENAU DIE SELBEN! Es wurde also einfach die Texture/UVMap "Copy and Paste" gemacht und auf den Panther und Panzer IV geklebt. Und dafür haben die nen halbes Jahr gebraucht.

Nun zu meinen größen Kritikpunkt und warum man dieses Spiel nicht herunterladen sollte:

Reperaturkosten für Waffen und Fahrzeuge!
Es ist ja völlig legitim das man Munition als Spieler eventuell bezahlen muss. Aber wenn mir dann noch vorgeschrieben wird WIE ich meine Munition nutzen soll, bekomm ich das kotzen!.

Wenn man einfach durch die gegend baller, oder im Kreis fährt mit dem EIGENEN Fahrzeug, wird man für "EXP-FARMING" gebannt.

Nicht zu letzt zahlt man für ein voll aufgepimptes STG44 bei einer 20/1 K/D mehr Reperaturen/Munition pro Match als man aus herausholen kann.

Und am besten ist wenn klamm heimlich nach einem Update die Reperaturkosten erhöht wurden!

Es hapert in diesem Spiel an so vielen dingen, man kann diese garnicht alle hier aufzählen. Es ist komplett:

-unfertig
-nicht richtig durchdacht
-spieler unfreundlich


Seit vielen Jahren hat sich an den Maps auch nichts geändert. Hin und wieder ändern sich mal gebäude oder positionen auf den Maps, aber die Spawnpoints sind immernoch die gleichen behinderten Spawnpoints. 

Ohne sinn und verstanden werden hier komplett sinnfrei Inhalte verändert und es wird sich nicht um die EIGENTLICHEN probleme im Spiel gekümmert. So zumbeispiel bleiben Projektile von Panzern einfach in Büschen hängen, oder ein Flugzeug kann einfach mal eine 75mm HE oder APCR wegstecken als wäre es ein laues lüftchen. Dabei ist es schon schwer als Panzerfahrer Flugzeuge zu treffen! Und das ist absolut keine Ausnahme! Sondern generell so!

Das aller schlimmste um was sich die Entwickler aber noch immernicht gekümmert haben obwohl es seit JAHREN angeprangert wird, ist der P-38 Flugzeug spamm, die P-38 kann jeden Panzer easy wegputzen und Auch Jeeps oder Motorräder sind kein problem. Das Spiel wird prinzip sofort unspielbar wenn mehr als 2 P-38 in der Luft sind. Besonders die Fallschirmspringer freuen sich!

Und was Flugzeuge angeht wäre wir beim nächsten Problem! Die Flugabwehrwaffen in diesem Spiel sind so extrem LÄCHERLICH, man kann einem Flugzeug mit einer VIERLINGSFLAK (4x20mm) mal so garkeinen wirklichen Schaden zufügen, aber die Piloten wissen EXAKT wo die Flugabwehr auf den Maps sitzt! Keine chance und mit der mobilen Flak auch keine chance.

Auch mit einer 20mm Bordkanone am Fahrzeug des Scharfschützen macht man dem Flugzeug keinen schaden, APCR/HE egal was man durchlädt. Aber die 20mm der Flugzeuge..... die Pustet alles von der Karte! Und genau das ist der Witz an der sache! Das ist schon IMMER und EWIG bekannt und wird nicht GEFIXT!

Im umkehrschluss kann man weder als Panzerfahrer noch als normaler Infanterist was gegen moderate bis gute Piloten machen! Währenddessen Infanteristen Panzer mit AT-Waffen mal eben in 3 Sekunden auflösen können, während Panzerfahrer keine gute rundumsicht genießen können ohne nicht die Rübe heraus zu stecken.

Ebenfalls ein riesen Fail ist das Panzerbalancing: Vergleich Hellcat gegen Panther.
Beide Fahrzeuge haben APCR und beide Fahrzeuge können sich gegenseitig mit zwei schüssen zerstören. Ja der Panther hat eine höhere Mündungsgeschwindigkeit was das Zielen minimal vereinfacht auf sehr großen Distanzen, solche Distanzen gibt es aber kaum bis garnicht im Spiel.
Durch die APCR Munition der Hellcat wird auch der Panzerungsvorteil des Panthers komplett weg negiert! 

Währenddessen die Hellcat praktisch genauso gut gepanzert ist wie der Panther und auch mit zwei schüssen einen Panzer der gleichen Klasse zerstören kann, ist die Hellcat im kontrast aber mal einfach so mobil wie ein Jeep. Und dazu kommt ein kleines Profil und ein sehr gutes Camo.


Also wurde auch hier beim Balancing TOTAL geschlafen. Und dabei wurden die Entwickler auch schon MEHRFACH auf das problem hingewiesen!

Die Entwickler sind einfach blutige Amateure. 


Daher empfehle ich auf das Spiel zu verzichten.

Tips für alle die dieses Spiel trotzdem Spielen wollen:
Am besten ihr Spiel nur mit Schaufel/Messer in möglichst langen Matches und versucht Fahnen/Eroberungspunkte zu sammeln. Den Ihr könnt so ofte Sterben wie ihr wollt ihr Zahlt keine Reperatur für Nahkampfwaffen und bekommt den vollen Paypout.

Oder Ihr hab nen Panzer und seit gut darin gute deutsche Modelle wären der 38t, Luchs, Panther und Königstiger. Dann kann man gut Credits farmen.
Das gleiche gilt für Flugzeuge. | Purtroppo il gioco è incredibilmente orientato al grinding e cerca in ogni modo possibile, patch dopo patch, di farti aprire il portafoglio (ammesso tu non voglia passare mesi per avere qualcosa).
Gli sviluppatori non ascoltano la community, delle tantissime buone idee che vengono suggerite ogni giorno sia sul forum di Steam che su quello del gioco ne viene presa una minima parte e mescolata con cose che nessuno ha chiesto (e che, spesso, nessuno vuole) e per ogni problema che viene risolto ne vengono inseriti altri.
Nelle suddette patch vengono inoltre "ninjate" cose tipo l'aumento di prezzi, la diminuzione dell'exp (dal quale dipendono i crediti) per determinate azioni; ovviamente non viene emesso alcun changelog in modo che non si sappia (di solito queste passano sotto il nome di "hotfix").
Le armi sono veramente irrealistiche e sbilanciate, la cosiddetta "war" (schermata "generals") è ancora più sbilanciata e viene spesso monopolizzata da una piuttosto che dall'altra fazione, la fazione tedesca è ridicola.
Spero vivamente che queste (e le tante altre) cose vengano prima o poi recepite da Reto e corrette, sia a livello di codice che di comportamento degli sviluppatori, ma fintanto che ciò non avverrà sconsiglio il gioco. | 一款不错的游戏

 | I'm afraid I cannot recommend this game. I tried, I played it for a while and I might continue to play it (in a more limited way), but honestly I think I'm done.

There are a few technical problems with the game:
Performance of the game varies highly between updates. I got anything from sustained 60 fps (with vsync on) at high quality setting to 20-25 on the lowest quality.
Weird lag issues. Game freezes momentarily on certain occasions, sometimes at crucial events, eg. just before being killed. This is not related to CPU or memory nor GFX card. I doubt it's network related. If it is, it's server side.

The game also feels a bit unbalanced. If enemy has air superiority, you're doomed. As ground unit there's not a lot you can do. This brings me to the next frustrating fact: you have several characters each has several weapons. You cannot swap [strike]characters or[/strike] weapons during a match. You have to leave the match, leave the squad and then you can swap weapons.

[i]EDIT: apparently you can swap characters if you have more than one of the same class. Thanks to RooZ for bringing this up. I haven't tested it, though. Swapping for a different class is possible if the squad has proper slots[/i]

There's a lot of griding as many have said. Personally I don't mind griding per se. What  I do mind is having to play for extended amount of time at a severe disadvantage. So either you pay money to upgrade fast or you are basically working for Reto as unpaid cannon fodder for their paying customers. In some games if you're good you may get a fighting chance. But not here. As infantry - yes. As tank crewman, not really. You will be put against superior tanks that you cannot harm with your puny cannon. And when you die you'll have to wait before spawning again and then walk or drive for a while to get to the action. There's a lot of waiting and walking in this game. I guess that makes it a more realistic military simulation. ;)

The grind is the price of a free game you say. Fair enough. However this game also suffers from the same problems as any other FPS, free or not. The lack of teamplay. When I first started playing H&G I saw how team actions (capturing) actually gives you significantly more score points compared to just killing an enemy. I said "wonderful, they found a way to make people actually do objectives". Sadly I was mistaken. Points schmoints. There are still very few people who will actively engage in coordinated cooperative gameplay. You'll get a circle of campers just outside capture zone. People will use resources without considering they're limited and waste them. Tank drivers will not rotate tanks so that support gunners may engage targets. Vehicles with MGs are never parked with their guns facing enemy positions. A fair amount will not follow common sense regarding objective selection and some will even roam aimlessly around the map.

I'd gladly pay money for a game with a nice teamplay-oriented community but this one isn't it.

So, should you play this free game? After all I said I might continue. If you do, stick to infantry, most vestatile, easiest to survive. Get a car or a motorbike to get from spawn area to the action. If you go for any other class, expect a lot more grinding and consider that your leveling strategy and point investment may be subverted by game designers at any point.

I randomly found this game about 10 years ago, when I was in university. I had fond memories of it, which I had totally forgotten about until one day I, again, randomly stumbled upon it during a publisher sale.

Rampage Knights is a fun and action-packed game with great replayability, and quite challenging gameplay. If you're a fan of adventure-themed beat 'em up games, this is definitely the right choice for you. | Обычный экшен-рогалик. Напрягло только управление. | crap | 吹爆

Ну что ж, я провёл в Носготе более 200 часов, из которых большая часть - в закрытой бете, так что пора бы написать обзор к этой игре. Обзор будет скорее для тех, кто только начал или заинтересовался игрой, с некоторой толикой своих личных мыслей по поводу отдельных моментов. 

Начать, пожалуй, следует с того, чем же меня заинтересовала игра. А заинтересовала она меня с первых скриншотов, на которых я увидел близкий мне жанр фэнтези, со своей атмосферой и магией. Меня сразу же зацепили отзывы, в которых другие игроки описывали происходящее не иначе как шахматной партией, только здесь соперничают не 2 игрока, а 8, и от каждого требуется слаженность действий, сосредоточенность и умение правильно оценить положение обеих команд. Учитывая, что каждая шахматная партия неповторима, можно провести подобную аналогию и с Носготом, ибо здесь каждый матч наполнен своим драйвом и непредсказуемостью. 

Но некоторые могут закричать: "Да это же КС, только у людей огнестрел, а у вампиров рукопашка, в КС тоже надо работать командой, и вообще, чтобы открывать кейсы тоже нужны мозги!" Нет. Ничего подобного. Работу командой подразумевает каждая кооп-игра, для открывания кейсов действительно нужны мозги, но для того, чтобы понять, что на эти самые кейсы не стоит тратиться. А вот на пункте об оружии остановлюсь поподробнее. Да, в игре 2 команды: люди и вампиры, у первых огнестрельное оружие, а вторые в основном полагаются лишь на свои когти в ближнем бою. Но и у тех, и у других есть особые навыки, помогающие одним убивать, а другим выживать. В игре пока что присутствует 4 класса людей, 4 класса вампиров. Их подробное описание с гайдами можно найти в сообществе, так что перечислю в двух словах. 

[h1] Люди: [/h1] 
1) Охотник - своеобразный танк, имеющий нехилый урон и от своего арбалета, и от навыков; 
2) Алхимик - гранатомётчик, самый дамажащий член команды, с возможностью хила союзников; 
3) Скаут - снайпер с луком; 
4) Пророк - маг с пистолетами, по мощи сравнимыми с обрезами. 

[h1] Вампиры: [/h1]
1) Ривер (переводится как "похититель", но оригинал, как по мне, звучит лучше) - настоящий охотник, выжидающий свою жертву, а затем неожиданно нападающий словно из ниоткуда; 
2) Громила ("деспот" с английского мне не нравится) - танк, наносит большой урон, но крайне медленный; 
3) Сентинел ("часовой") - летающий вампир, способность летать очень доставляет, к тому же он единственный, кому вообще доступна возможность полёта; 
4) Десивер ("обманщик") - своеобразный маг вампиров, может контролировать разум людей, превращаться в них, а также становиться невидимым. 

И это еще не все, ведь у каждого класса есть по несколько навыков, причем их можно настроить в разных сочетаниях под свой стиль игры + разработчики обещают ввести в игру минимум 2 класса (1 человек - 1 вампир) в ближайшее время. 
Но саме главное в игре - антураж. Именно атмосфера игры и стала той особенностью, которая поймала меня на крючок. Ну действительно, где еще можно разыграть партию вампиры против людей на средневековую тематику? | Сложно однозначно сказать про эту игру. С одной стороны Носгот прекрасен, но с другой отвратителен. 
Я провел в этой игре много часов. Проведу еще больше. Но сегодня захотелось выговориться, ибо последние 2 вечера игры заставли меня рыдать. В этом я виню только разработчиков! Ну нельзя делать так, как они делают. Это крайне наплевательское отношение к основополагающим проблемам, тянущимся с самого гребаного начала. Сраный матчмейкинг выжимает нервы досуха. Ну нельзя делать в СОЛО-лиге возможность играть фулл-пати. Ну какого хуя должны страдать одиночки вроде меня? Мне осточертело видеть у себя в команде игроков 200-300 часов против 600-1000, трое из которых в пати (а то и все 4). Почему нельзя сделать тонкую настройку "пати vs пати"? Ну или хотя бы отфильтровать противоборствующие команды по кол-ву игровых часов? Ну это же гораздо показательнее сраных коэффициентных вычислений скилла, которые действуют сейчас! Почему после оглушительного проигрыша, если не ждать, а сразу нажать поиск нового матча, то тебя кидает против все той же гоп-пати? После каждого такого финта мне очень обидно... Обидно за игру, обидно за всех тех, кто покинул игру из-за вышеобозначенной проблемы. Но больше всего мне обидно за себя.
Не существует нейтральной оценки, поэтому ставлю "не рекомендую". Тем кому жаль своих нервов, проходите пока что мимо, потому что вы будете страдать.
Ну а что касается меня... "Мыши плакали, давились, но продолжали есть кактус". | As almost any negative review is only negative because of the matchmaking (and the person who wrote that review dying constantly), I'm gonna say a little things about that:

They've fixed the matchmaking and even improved it several times. There was just one problem everybody ignored:
Back in Closed Beta the matchmaking could not function properly, as there were not enough players to filter from!

But now in Open Beta you can finally see how the matchmaking works. Everytime I play in a party with several other people, we get split up, because the enemy team would lose directly. Also, the more "good" people I have in my party, the longer it takes now to find a match, so the matchmaking is really working in the background.

Now my review about this game:
It's wonderful!
It's quite competitive, so it happens that you lose against people you are playing against, but the most important thing to note is that even though this game is f2p, it is definetly not p2w.
In this game it's not so much about your weapons or skills, as the basic skills can be damn good, if used correctly.
It's mainly about having a good teamplay, and voicechat is not that much required for that. 

Also what I experienced as well, while I introduced some friends of mine to this game, while I was already playing with highlevel players:
You get better over time!

This game has no major flaws, it's just not as casual as people would expect it to be on the normal TDM server.
While in other games as soon as you leave the "Beginner"-area you lose against p2w players, in this game you are challenged by players, whose only advantage is that they've played more hours in this game than you.

Das Vampiere und Jäger sich nicht gerade mögen ist altbekannt. Das fast dann auch ganz fix zusammen worum es im Spiel geht. Jäger vs Vampiere. 

Wie funktioniert es:
Jede Runde spielt man auf der Seite einer Fraktion, so dass beide Teams am Ende (2 Runden) jede Fraktion einmal gespielt haben. Am Ende entscheidet sich, wer am meisten Kills (maximal 30 pro Runde) ergattern konnte.

Wie spielt es sich:
Die Jäger sind stark im Fernkampf allerdings überstehen sie nahkämpfe nicht wirklich gut. Teamarbeit ist angesagt und wer alleine rennt ist ziemlich fix Futter für die Vampiere. Als Jäger müssen wir mit einigen Nachteilen Leben, so können wir zum Beispiel nciht auf Häuser klettern. Wir sind an den Boden gebunden. verstecken und Hinterhalte werden hier besonders wichtig. So bieten zum Beispiel Häuer gute Plätze um sich zu verstecken und einen nichts ahnenden Blutsauger dingfest zu machen

Die Vampire verzichten auf Fernkampf sind dafür aber auch stark im Nahkampf. Sie spielen sich daher grundverschieden. Wo die Jäger versuchen ihre Gegner fern zu halten wollen die Vampiere in den Nahkampf. Aber auch für sie gilt, Teamspiel ist angesagt und vorrausehend Spielen. Wer immer den gleichen Gang auf den gegner zurennt lebt nicht lange. Aber was können sie anderes? Die Vampire können klettern und ihnen steht so mehr Raum zum Bewegen zur verfügung, hinzukommen Fertigkeiten um diesen Raum zu überbrücken. Zum Beispiel ein Charge für den Tyran und ein Srung für den "normalen" Vampier. Beides wil lgekonnt genutzt werden. 

All das bringt trotz der recht kleinen Leven und 4vs4 Kämpfe eine recht hohe Dynamik ins Spiel. wer sich nach kurzem Spiel einfuchst wird auch schnell Erfolge erzielen und dennoch ordentlich auf die Nase bekommen. Denn beide Seiten haben ihre stärken und schwächen.

Pro:
+Dynamisches Gameplay
+keine glitzer Vampiere
+Rasant und Langsam
+für mich hohes Niveau zum lernen.
+Bugfrei bisher

Negativ:
+Wenig Klassen
+Beide Setien auf Nah oder Fernkampf beschränkt. Ei nVampier der nicht klettern kann mit Fernkampf und ein Nahkampfjäger, welcher Klettern kann wären die Ideale Ergänzung
+kleiner Frameeinbrüche
+Frustgrad ist hoch
+Noch keine Ingamebelohnungen

Fazit: Das Grundgerüst ist solide und solange ein P2W fernbleibt kann ich es nur ans Herzlegen es sich anzusehen, wer von Twilight und Co die Nase voll hat oder mal einen etwas anderen "Shooter" spielen will, der sollte gerne einen Blick riskieren. Gefährlich lebt es sich auf jeder Seite, als sei bereit nicht nur ein mal am Anfang zu sterben.

A little background, I am both a big fan of the 'free to play' model as well as the Magic The Gathering card game.
I've been playing Magic for about four years now.
I've owned a few of the other digital game versions as well as having a few competitive decks in real life as well.

It's been no secret that many people have found the digital series to be pretty hit or miss. I don't know what Wizard's of The Coast does to miss the boat so hard. But I'll first put this review into a technical and then a business sense:

What works about the game:
-Bare bones, the game launches, plays, has a GUI and from what I've seen as of February, very little bugs. It's a smooth experience to start and once you get into the interface it's an enjoyable segue into the game.
-The music as always is top notch. I have yet to see anyone lodge a complaint against the music
-Fair art direction. The cards already have art that they have on file so it's hard to say that they really go out of their way with the art on the cards. However, the 3D cutscenes don't quite match the style of the cards and come off more as a Nickelodeon spinoff of Magic; which, depending on your preference, may be a good thing.
-The deck builder that everyone's been asking for is here. People complain about it not featuring a 'search by name' function. But I truly don't care. If you can remember the picture it takes all of about two seconds. And even if you unlock all the cards, it doesn't hurt to give your other options a browse while you flip to the card you want.

What doesn't work-
Now, before I get into the blemishes, it should be said that I generally enjoy the game but a review in my book is to tell people whether or not the product is worth investing in.
-The RNG. The point of the RNG being so poor is obviously an incentive to get you to buy more and more boosters. Hopefully with your own money. An easy way to observe this is to play the story mode decks. The 'challenge' often doesn't come from having a winnable deck and being forced to outthink your opponent's cards. It's redrawing, and restarting the duel over and over and over until you get a really good hand, (Hopefully with good draws afterward) and sometimes even then, some duels I found were almost impossible to win unless the opponent suffered from several bad draws.
-The Free To Pay model. Now, as I said, I love Free to Play. That's an awesome step forward with games with a competitive environment. I'll talk more about that in a second. But the problem here is that in the competitive side of the game, there's a huge incentive put on buying better cards than everyone else. Keep buy buy buying and hope your RNG gets you better cards than the other guy. A little RNG isn't bad, it keeps things interesting. However, when the incentive is to force the player to spend money when they would rather play with skill, then it's a waste of development time as you'll be seeing diminishing returns on your usage of those features.

What's just in the middle?
Well, between good and bad there's a few things that just sort of fall by the wayside.
-The free cards you earn are not very competitive.
Grinding for better cards can be fun. However, it shouldn't be done in the multiplayer against people with better cards, or at the very least not left to RNG boosters. Not neccessarily saying that the cards offered from the story should be perfectly competitive, but at least enough (if you've completed the whole story) to be able to play against starting level duelists.
-Lack of dynamic matchmaking
As far as I can tell, there's not really any matchmaking algorithms in place to match you with people at your skill level. You seem to be matched with just whoever happens to be playing. This results often in playing against other players with much better or much worse cards than you rather than someone who offers a challenge and a fun game.
-Lack of players
I don't know how many people actually play this game. But I'm judging that not a lot do from how long it can take to matchmake. I guess many people would just rather play the hard-format card game.

Ways to fix it really simply-
1.) First fix and probably most important: specifically two modes that I think will make the game even worth installing-
-Team battle: Basically, five players on each team (5v5) or (4v4) or (3v3) duel it out with premade competitive decks (similar to picking a hero in Dota, each deck has unique themes and abilities and once picked, can't be picked by the enemy team).
This is going to be the main draw of the game. Teams can use game chat to speak to eachother, and make tactical decisions. Suddenly there's a team dynamic, and it's even better than just playing 1v1 with a friend.
-Free battles: These are the current gametypes but reworked. #2 will talk about how to improve this mode. These are duels using decks that you've assembled yourself using the cards that are in the game. However, there can be certain rules applied:
Legacy, Modern, etc.

2.)Observe functioning Free to play systems: perhaps some of the best and most marketably viable free to play models are actually on Steam. Team Fortress and Dota 2 come with their own brand of users and you take them or leave them. Magic is much the same. However to make Magic work as an online game, all the content of the game needs to be free and readily available with balancing patches to control the meta game.
The reason why this works: players can spend more time on the game getting better, and more competitive with the game. Switching the content you want to buy to cosmetic, makes the game more worth playing.

3.) By switching the focus to cosmetic, people invest more time into the game. As they invest, they spend more. I hate to say it, but Dota found the magic formula. You spend X amount of hours and as X+fun=Financial investment.
Now you may say, but that still applies to this game! However, consider that because it's also pay to win RNG, you've got to face facts and admit that you've also got, X+fun-(loss x loss conditions)=fincancial investment. The greater the amount of losses, the less likely that user is to spend money on anything in the game. Nobody except a very small handful of people with huge egos will buy boosters just to compete in a pay to win game. It's very niche. The rest of the people willing to buy are hardcore magic fans who are already likely to just buy hard copies of cards.

Ultimately Wizards is in no financial trouble. However, they are walking away from a lot of money with this particular online game. By tweaking their approach by a bit, their financial rewards could be greater.

Players however, if you are a huge Magic fan then you'll love that the game is free to play, but may grow tired of the monotonous grinding for boosters and long loss streaks in attempts to get better cards with less frustrating outcomes.
If you're not a fan of Magic, but a fan of card games looking to install one on steam, then try it out.
If you're not a fan of Magic and can take or leave a card game, then pass. There are plenty of other, (better) free to play games out there.

She looks good and smells good, so you talk with her and start remembering why you loved her in the first place and want to try it again, and everything is great until she stabs you in the hand with a fork because you were chewing or breathing too loud. But sooner or later, you'll want to try it again."[/i]

[h1]ACTUAL REVIEW[/h1]

I've invested a decent amount of time and more money than I care to admit in this game, so I feel its time to give it an honest review.

[u]Pros[/u]
+ Teaches you how to play MTG, So it's a good game to pick up for new players along with returning players needing a refresher.
+ Atmospheric campaigns that introduce you to each new set while also earning you coins.
+ Game limits your collection and deck to only one mythic, 2 rares, 3 uncommon, and 4 common cards of any individual card. This creates an artificial buffer and prevents players with too much money/time from building crazy decks that will dominate the metagame. 
+ Finite amount of cards for each set, meaning eventually you will have every card in the set. With older sets going on sale every so often to help build your collection more quickly.
+ 150 coin price tag is very fair for a booster of 6 cards. Winning a multiplayer match earns you 30 coins plus any bonuses for completing weekly and daily quests means you can unlock at least one new booster every day with a decent deck.
+ Every set since Origins has been included, and they continue to add new blocks as they come out, with some card exceptions that would be too complicated to code in a vs format.
+ All the fun of FNM, minus the smell.

[u]Cons[/u]
- Mana tapping system needs work, though there is a mana tapping key, often times it either doesn't work correctly or is just too clucky to use in the limited time you have to play your turn. Nothing is more frustrating than a match going sideways because the game chose to tap the wrong mana for you.
- Game is very buggy at times, I had to leave a match I was winning because the game refused to unzoom a card and blocked my view of the battlefield. Another time, the game froze on the "opponent watching animations screen" and it cost me the match. 
- Game has been out long enough for there to be enough "auto include" mythics and rares between all the sets to make it frustrating to play vs battles at times. I've run out of fingers and toes for the amount of times I've seen "Combustable Gearhulk" in any deck that has red in it.
- Game really favors the constructed format of the game, which can be jarring/frustrating for players that like to play limted formats like draft, sealed, and pauper. 
- Plainswalkers dominate the game. Some are pretty benign, but you'll see the frustrating ones enough to make you walk away from the game at times. (I personally haven't liked plainswalkers when they were introduced years ago, At least back then they were reasonable being 6 drops with something along the lines of "+1: Target creature gets +1/+1" not 4 drops with "+3: Make game unplayable.")
- No In-game chat with other players. (I would probably get banned if we actually had this, I'm humble enough to know I can be a sore winner/loser.)
-All the frustration of FNM, minus the smell.

I really like Magic duels, but I also hate it just as much. I've lost count of how many times I've walked away from the game, never to play again, just to find myself back again in another duel 30 minutes later. I honestly think you need to be a little bit of a masochist to enjoy this game. 

If you like MTG, you'll feed that itch with this game. If you want to learn MTG, this game is a good jumping off point. If you want to stare blankly at the screen in a silent burning rage that could fuel a thousand suns, this game is for you.

5 different planes add some good depth to it. 
If you're a beginner- it's worth finding a football server with bots, and learning how to pass and all that. Also there's a good fun tutorial prepared by altitude.

It was really fun, though.  Like a lot of games that have an overall account level, though, it wasn't the most balanced.  Later upgrades and planes were just, you know, objectively better than starting things.  The ships aren't necessarily rock-paper-scissors in design but there are elements like that to them.  Having said that, the starting ship is probably the best one, which is good for beginners.

Regardless, the ships were balanced enough that you could play whatever and probably be fine in most situations.  The game modes were varied enough.  You had death match and team death match, yeah, but there was also a mode where you destroyed an enemy base, and another where you effectively played soccor with the space ships.  I really liked the last one, but they were all fun and I'd play whatever when I did.

Controls were fine, graphics were fine, sounds were fine.  The only problem I ever encountered were some latency issues, where people would just appear to teleport somewhere else or where you were clearly disconnecting (everyone was falling or flying into walls).

Yeah, every now and then I boot this up and try to figure out my old account, or to make my old account work, but it never happens.  Had a lot of good times and I would totally play some more, if not a lot, should I ever fix that.  Good game, if you see it on sale, do check it out.  Assuming it's still alive.  It might not be!

The edit: game is mostly dead except for old elitists, apparently.  Shame.  Guess they are a pretty closed off community and not friendly to newbs.  Oh well. I usually get bored with strategy games quickly, but Frostpunk sucked me in. It keeps things tight and exciting, with an enemy more terrifying than any AI-controlled army: the cold. In my first playthrough, I have made terrifying sacrifices to get a handful of survivors through the winter. With other games, I would have left it at that, but with Frostpunk, my brain kept working on different strategies even in my sleep. The next day I started again and managed to build a more gentle society that was more fit for survival. Kept hundreds of people alive without crossing any serious moral lines. I'm worried, that I can't stop thinking about more effective way to build my city and society. Maybe I can do it without child labor? Maybe there's a way for me to take in all refugees I encounter? The tight focus of the game helps my thoughts get completely lost among the opportunities. Love it.

(75% 할인 받은 걸 다행이라고 해야되나) | TLDR: This is a good exploration game, that features 6 major boss fights. It's not terribly long, and it's chill apart from having to deal with a some clunky features in the battle system.

I enjoy this game- it's relatively chill, up until you hit the different area bosses. You can complete each area in any order, so if you want to farm all the health and ability upgrades before doing the bosses, you can. The levels are neat, with some lore spread throughout. The music and voice over are really good, and I appreciate that they decided to record the dialogue in Icelandic. The art is interesting, and I appreciate that they tried to do something unique with it- it really shines with the bosses and creatures, and some of the environments are genuinely lovely. The boss fights are fun, and the the patterns are well telegraphed- I really enjoyed the Ice Jotun, and the Sky Jotun. That doesn't keep it from being frustrating though at times. 

Your character moves slow, the arena maps are large, and the giants have long steps (as they would be expected to have). You spend a lot of time chasing the giants around the arena, for a few hits, before they move again. The god abilities are frustrating to use, as they're on a bar that you cycle through. It's distracting to go from one ability to the next, and you have to watch what ability you have selected, which draws your attention away from the boss. It's easy to overshoot the ability you want, and you can't rearrange the skills to make it easier to get to the skills you need quickly. The selection does cycle from the end , back to the beginning, but that just once again means you sometimes roll past the thing you need. It would have felt more smooth to be able to assign the abilities to key/button presses in order to make better use of muscle memory, and it's hard not to feel like a fair number of deaths are because of this clunky feature. I would use all the abilities more often, if I didn't feel like I had to be on the most helpful skills, all the time, just in case.
I've gotten Odin down to 20% of his health a few times now, and am not sure I will complete the game due to this. I may just youtube the end of the game instead, but it was still enjoyable to try the game overall.

I will say for completionists, there is one persistent bug for the Northern Sky map which does not register you collecting the Mimir check point. This bug has been in the game since at least mid 2023, and hasn't been fixed. In order to get the achievement for completion, you need to change the game file to an older build through steam, and collect it using that version of the game.
Go to "Properties -> Betas" and in the "Beta participation" drop down menu select "oldversion - oldversion"; the save files are apparently compatible. | This game is SO SLOW.I would walk, and it would be like 10 seconds to just get across one screen in a whole area. I found the abilities to be quite useless. I only used the healing, which by the end only recovers about 1/3 of your health (with 3 uses, you can roughly fill your health bar all the way back up once), and Mjolnir, which basically shaved off a few hits during boss battles (and since each attack sequence took anywhere between 10 and 30 seconds, it was a big time-saver). But because it only worked with heavy attacks, you had to basically be on top of it where you could trigger it AND get a heavy swing in before the boss moved again, which was very rare. I don't recall wasting so many limited-use abilities as I did in this game. And I tried triggering the other abilities, which mostly didn't really do anything useful. The shield, for example—if you needed it, you were probably dead, anyway.
For some reason, I wanted to be able to recommend this game because I'm a softie for pretty indie games with worlds that bring to life cultures and myths. I remember not being able to join friends and after a few games, I decided the game wasn't for me and just another clone.

Being bored and only seeing games with no depth in gameplay and just essentially imitating the original MOBA/FPS formula, I decided to give Gigantic another shot after it came out for Steam. I'm originally from DotA and MMORPG pvp-style games, so having a MOBA-esque theme with third-person gameplay actually fit my needs.

Some elements I definitely like about the game are the strategy involved, artstyle, animations, colorful particles. 
I mean your nexus/core actually jumps to the other side of the field to crush the enemy nexus/core? WTF. These Guardians are huge and makes you feel right there on the battlefield. Not to mention the fact that Clash mode completely changes the map.

On the surface, the game seems pretty simple. You lay minions on control points, you kill other people, and you win the game by killing the enemy boss. What you don't see are the strategic elements in the game. Some examples being:

[*]What limited creature do I summon on this point?

[*]Do I spend my focus on upgrading the creature to an adult or keep it so I can use my ultimate?

[*]One of the Guardians (Boss) is going on a rampage, do I defend/attack the Guardian or do I attack a control point to put more points into the next round?

Then you add on to the defending, healing, sprinting, dodging, engaging, killing, wounding fast-paced part of the game, it becomes quite immersive. Seriously, this game is [b]fast-paced AF[/b] (game time and movement speed). I don't think I've played a game as fast as this. You sprint literally everywhere.

Anyway, back on topic. Motiga isn't a big company, but they seem to be on track with feedback and updates. 
Whether this game gets popular in the future, I definitely plan to stick with this game. A game formula that I actually enjoy with amazing art is rare for me.

I mean this game is F2P. Give it a shot and try it out for yourself and mold your own thoughts. What do you have to lose?
